# insetApplicationFrame

**Type Property**

The application frame is reduced in size to compensate for overscan. Content drawn outside the application frame may be clipped.

## Declaration

```swift
static var insetApplicationFrame: UIScreen.OverscanCompensation { get }
```

## Constants

- **UIScreen.OverscanCompensation.scale**: The final composited framebuffer for the screen is scaled so that all pixels lie in the area visible on the screen.
- **UIScreen.OverscanCompensation.insetBounds**: The screen bounds are reduced in size so that all pixels in the framebuffer are visible on the screen.
- **UIScreen.OverscanCompensation.none**: No scaling occurs. Use [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScreen/overscanCompensationInsets] to get the insets required to avoid clipping.
